divs: Sighting DetailsI was sitting outside with my dad tonight (July 3, 2011) on our front step around 10:30 PM in Philadelphia enjoying the 4th of July weekend when I noticed an orange ball floating in the sky. Having just watched a fireworks display at the park behind my house that had ended 15 minutes earlier, I initially thought it was a stray spark floating in the wind and brushed it off. I had pointed it out to my dad and he agreed that it was just that. However, the spark did not fizzle out like we've seen happen with other fireworks - and we began to realize that it was moving at a slow, steady speed in the direction of my house. Then, it curved and headed North. It started out as a tiny ball, but as it moved we watched it shrink down into a pin point and vanish somewhere over Northeast Philadelphia.
